intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon var. decaryana, commonly known as the red-stemmed tarrietia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that are often reddish in color, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in hue, blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Malvaceae family.
